title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs Used : , B, C, D, E, F, G, H, , J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W1, W2, X1, X2, Y, Z Criteria: histic epipedon underlain mineral soil material chroma 2 less.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs Used : , B, C, D, E, F, G, H, , J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W1, W2, X1, X2, Y, Z Criteria: layer peat, mucky peat, muck 20 cm (8 inches) thick starts depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface; hue 10YR yellower, value 3 less, chroma 1 less; underlain mineral soil material chroma 2 less.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs Used : , B, C, D, E, F, G, H, , J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, W1, W2, X1, X2, Y, Z Criteria: hydrogen sulfide odor starting depth <=30 cm (12 inches) soil surface.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs C, F, K, L, M, N, O, P, R, S, T, U; testing LRRs Q, V Z Used : C, F, K, L, M, N, O, P, R, S, T, U Test : Q, V, Z Criteria: Several stratified layers starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface. least one layers value 3 less chroma 1 less, muck, mucky peat, peat, mucky modified mineral texture. remaining layers chroma 2 less. sandy material constitutes layer value 3 less chroma 1 less, least 70 percent visible soil particles must masked organic material, viewed 10x 15x hand lens. Observed without hand lens, particles appear close 100 percent masked.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs P (except MLRA 136), T, U, Z Used : P, T, U, Z Except MLRA: 136 Criteria: Presence 2 percent organic bodies muck mucky modified mineral texture starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs P (except MLRA 136), T, U, Z Used : P, T, U, Z Except MLRA: 136 Criteria: layer mucky modified mineral soil material 5 cm (2 inches) thick, starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface (Figure 13).

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs Q, U, V, Z Used : Q, U, V, Z Criteria: layer muck value 3 less chroma 1 less, starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs D, F, G, H, P (except MLRA 136), T; testing LRRs C, , J, O Used : D, F, G, H, P, T Except MLRA: 136 Test : C, , J, O Criteria: layer muck 1 cm (0.5 inch) thick value 3 less chroma 1 less starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRR M N; testing LRRs , B, E, K, L, S (except MLRA 148) Used : M, N Test : , B, E, K, L, S Except MLRA: 148 Criteria: layer muck 2 cm (0.75 inch) thick value 3 less chroma 1 less, starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use LRRs, except W, X, Y; testing LRRs W, X, Y Used : , B, C, D, E, F, G, H, , J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, Z Test : W1, W2, X1, X2, Y Criteria: layer depleted gleyed matrix 60 percent chroma 2 less, starting depth <=30 cm (12 inches) soil surface, minimum thickness either: () 15 cm (6 inches), (b) 5 cm (2 inches) 5 cm consists fragmental soil material. Organic, loamy, clayey layer(s) depleted gleyed matrix must value 3 less chroma 2 less starting depth <15 cm (6 inches) soil surface extend depleted gleyed matrix. sandy material depleted gleyed matrix must value 3 less chroma 1 less starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface extend depleted gleyed matrix. Viewed 10x 15x hand lens, least 70 percent visible sand particles must masked organic material. Observed without hand lens, sand particles appear close 100 percent masked.

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States

title: Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: use MLRA 150A LRR T; testing LRR S (except MLRA 149B) Used : 150A Test : S Except MLRA: 149B Criteria: layer starting depth <=15 cm (6 inches) soil surface least 10 cm (4 inches) thick matrix chroma 3 less 2 percent distinct prominent redox concentrations occurring soft masses /pore linings.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew G. Brown. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brown AG (2024). hydricsoils: Tools 'Field Indicators Hydric Soils United States'. R package version 0.1.0.9002, https://humus.rocks/hydricsoils/, https://github.com/brownag/hydricsoils/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hydricsoils: Tools for 'Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States'},   author = {Andrew G. Brown},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9002, https://humus.rocks/hydricsoils/},   url = {https://github.com/brownag/hydricsoils/}, }

what: Tools for Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
title: Tools for Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: goal {hydricsoils} provide easy access definitions, criteria, area applicability ‘Field Indicators Hydric Soils United States’ also provide tools assist evaluating associated soil morphology.

title: Tools for Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: can install development version {hydricsoils} like :

title: Tools for Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: basic example shows determine area applicability indicator “A9” (also known “1 cm Muck”). load MLRA v5.2 database using lrrmlra_geometry() (requires {terra}) can visualize extent “A9” indicator used. function package called plot_indicator_usage() simplifies process loading subsetting geometry. provides simple defaults visualizing areas usage “Approved”, “Excluded” “Testing”.
code: library(hydricsoils) #> hydricsoils v0.1.0.9002 -- using: #>  - 'Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States' v8.2 (2018) #>  - 'Land Resource Regions and Major Land Resource Areas of the United States, the Caribbean, and the Pacific Basin' v5.2 (2022)  data(fihs, package = "hydricsoils")  subset(fihs, fihs$indicator == "A9", select = c("usage", "usage_symbols", "except_mlra")) #>                                                                                             usage #> 11 For use in LRRs D, F, G, H, P (except for MLRA 136), and T; for testing in LRRs C, I, J, and O #>       usage_symbols except_mlra #> 11 D, F, G, H, P, T         136 plot_indicator_usage("A9", test_areas = TRUE, ext = c("Approved", "Excluded"), plg = list(x = "bottomleft")) #> Loading required namespace: terra

title: Tools for Field Indicators of Hydric Soils in the United States
text: Next let’s find indicators can used LRR “C” (also known “California Subtropical Fruit, Truck, Specialty Crop Region”) Compare LRR “D” (also known “Western Range Irrigated Region”) outputs match information can find guide Appendix 1. important remember area applicability across Land Resource Regions Major Land Resource Areas can subtly differ. main difference LRRs “C” “D” indicator “A5” approved use LRR “C” whereas “A9” approved use LRR “D”. Note “A9” available testing “C”, “A5” considered use LRR “D”. can visualize expanding first example include “A5” separate pane. limit extent just LRRs “C” “D”.
code: subset(fihs, sapply(fihs$usage_symbols, \(x) any(x == "C")), select = c("indicator", "indicator_name")) #>    indicator              indicator_name #> 3         A1          Histosol or Histel #> 4         A2             Histic Epipedon #> 5         A3                Black Histic #> 6         A4            Hydrogen Sulfide #> 7         A5           Stratified Layers #> 13       A11 Depleted Below Dark Surface #> 14       A12          Thick Dark Surface #> 21        S1         Sandy Mucky Mineral #> 24        S4         Sandy Gleyed Matrix #> 25        S5                 Sandy Redox #> 26        S6             Stripped Matrix #> 33        F1         Loamy Mucky Mineral #> 34        F2         Loamy Gleyed Matrix #> 35        F3             Depleted Matrix #> 36        F6          Redox Dark Surface #> 37        F7       Depleted Dark Surface #> 38        F8           Redox Depressions subset(fihs, sapply(fihs$usage_symbols, \(x) any(x == "D")),         select = c("indicator", "indicator_name")) #>    indicator              indicator_name #> 3         A1          Histosol or Histel #> 4         A2             Histic Epipedon #> 5         A3                Black Histic #> 6         A4            Hydrogen Sulfide #> 11        A9                   1 cm Muck #> 13       A11 Depleted Below Dark Surface #> 14       A12          Thick Dark Surface #> 21        S1         Sandy Mucky Mineral #> 24        S4         Sandy Gleyed Matrix #> 25        S5                 Sandy Redox #> 26        S6             Stripped Matrix #> 33        F1         Loamy Mucky Mineral #> 34        F2         Loamy Gleyed Matrix #> 35        F3             Depleted Matrix #> 36        F6          Redox Dark Surface #> 37        F7       Depleted Dark Surface #> 38        F8           Redox Depressions x <- lrrmlra_geometry() xext <- subset(x, x$LRRSYM %in% c("C", "D"))  par(mfrow = c(2, 1)) plot_indicator_usage("A5", test_areas = TRUE, ext = xext) plot_indicator_usage("A9", test_areas = TRUE, ext = xext)

Default path uses GDAL Virtual File Systems access decompress remote source ("/vsizip//vsicurl/https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/MLRA_52_2022.zip/MLRA_52_2022").

title: Download and Cache or Load Latest 'MLRA Geographic Database' — cache_lrrmlra_geometry
text: cache_lrrmlra_geometry(): logical. Called side-effect adding MLRA geometry file cache. Returns TRUE "lrrmlra.gpkg" file exists user's "data" cache directory. clear_lrrmlra_geometry(): logical. Called side-effect removing MLRA geometry file cache. Returns TRUE "lrrmlra.gpkg" successfully removed user data cache. lrrmlra_geometry(): terra SpatVector object containing lrrmlra attributes geometry.

text: Plot Usage Area Field Indicator Hydric Soils

title: Plot the Usage Area of a Field Indicator for Hydric Soils — plot_indicator_usage
code: plot_indicator_usage(   indicator,   ext = NULL,   plg = NULL,   crs = NULL,   test_areas = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   dsn = NULL )

title: Plot the Usage Area of a Field Indicator for Hydric Soils — plot_indicator_usage
text: indicator character. alphanumeric code corresponding indicator interest. example: "A12" ext SpatExtent, SpatVector, SpatRaster, character. Either terra object can converted SpatExtent. Alternately, character vector denoting usage constraints (one "Approved", "Excluded", "Testing"). resulting SpatExtent passed ext argument terra::plot(). plg list. Passed plg argument terra::plot(). crs character. Optional: target coordinate reference system project lrrmlra_geometry() result . Default: NULL uses "OGC:CRS84" geographic coordinate system. test_areas logical. Show areas indicator tested? Default: FALSE overwrite logical. Passed lrrmlra_geometry(). Default: FALSE dsn character. Passed lrrmlra_geometry(). Default: NULL uses default remote source via GDAL Virtual File System.

title: Plot the Usage Area of a Field Indicator for Hydric Soils — plot_indicator_usage
text: function called side effect creating output graphics pane.

title: Plot the Usage Area of a Field Indicator for Hydric Soils — plot_indicator_usage
code: par(mfrow = c(2, 1)) plot_indicator_usage("A5", test_areas = TRUE, ext = c("Approved", "Excluded")) plot_indicator_usage("A9", test_areas = TRUE, ext = c("Approved", "Excluded"))

title: hydricsoils (development version)
text: Improvements initial parsing routine fhis dataset; cross-checked appendix text content guide. Added usage columns test_symbols test_except_mlra fihs dataset indicating established indicators tested Added plot_indicator_usage() terra-based graphical method visualizing area applicability indicators. Added lrrmlra dataset containing tabular data describing MLRA LRR symbols names Added lrrmlra_geometry() associated cache-managment methods storing (larger) geometry data associated lrrmlra local GeoPackage file created official source data.
